                    ### Question
                    Which of the following antitubercular drugs can be safely used in severe renal failure :

                    ### Options
                    opa. Streptomycin
opb. Ethambutol
opc. Capreomycin
opd. Rifampicin

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Rifampicin is the safest antitubercular drug for use in severe renal failure due to its primary metabolism by the liver, minimizing renal stress. Ethambutol may be used with careful dose adjustments and monitoring. Streptomycin and Capreomycin are not recommended due to their primary renal excretion and associated high toxicity risk in renal failure.
